item.title: Becoming a DevOps Engineer - Part 1
item.description: Becoming a DevOps Engineer Introduction Broadly, DevOps refers to the re-modelling of IT culture to improve software delivery outcomes (e.g. speed, reliability, and stability) by fostering collaboration and shared objectives throughout all stages of the SDLC. The practical consequence of this ideological shift is the cumulation of a set of principles, practices, and tools which form the necessary foundation for DevOps to be successful within an organisation. The aim of this blog post isn’t to provide yet another overview of what DevOps is and isn’t; a quick search of Google will produce enough attempts at this to last the reader a lifetime (although this is my personal favourite).
